channel.title: NASA Breaking News
channel.description: A RSS news feed containing the latest NASA news articles and press releases.

item.title: NASA Invites Media to SpaceX In-Flight Abort Test for Commercial Crew
item.description: Media accreditation is open for SpaceX’s In-Flight Abort Test as part of NASA’s Commercial Crew Program. The flight test of SpaceX’s Falcon 9 rocket and Crew Dragon spacecraft is targeted for no earlier than December – an exact test date still is to be determined -- from historic Launch Complex 39A at NASA’s Kennedy Space Center in Florida.

item.title: NASA Awards Program Analysis and Control V Contract
item.description: NASA has awarded an 8(a) small business set-aside contract to ASRC Federal Systems Solutions, LLC, in Beltsville, Maryland, for services that support planning and managing of NASA missions, projects, and programs.

item.title: NASA Announces Ninth Consecutive Clean Financial Audit Opinion
item.description: The NASA Office of the Chief Financial Officer (OCFO) has led the way for an unmodified audit opinion on the agency’s fiscal year 2019 (FY 2019) financial statements. This represents NASA’s ninth consecutive "clean" opinion from an independent accounting firm – the highest opinion possible.

item.title: NASA Highlights Science on 19th SpaceX Resupply Mission to Space Station
item.description: NASA will host a media teleconference at 1 p.m. EST Wednesday, Nov. 20, to discuss select science investigations launching on the next SpaceX commercial resupply flight to the International Space Station.

item.title: New Companies Join Growing Ranks of NASA Partners for Artemis Program
item.description: NASA has added five American companies to the pool of vendors that will be eligible to bid on proposals to provide deliveries to the surface of the Moon through the agency’s Commercial Lunar Payload Services (CLPS) initiative.

item.title: NASA to Announce Additional Commercial Moon Delivery Providers
item.description: NASA will host a media teleconference at 4:30 p.m. EST Monday, Nov. 18, to announce additional American companies joining the competitive pool for delivery services to the surface of the Moon through the agency’s Commercial Lunar Payload Services (CLPS) project.

item.title: Vice President Pence to Visit NASA’s Ames Research Center, Discuss Lunar Exploration
item.description: Vice President Mike Pence, along with NASA Administrator Jim Bridenstine, will visit NASA's Ames Research Center in California’s Silicon Valley Thursday, Nov. 14, to discuss the role the center will play in the agency’s plans to return astronauts to the Moon.

item.title: Media Invited to Artemis Day, Unveiling of Moon Mission Rocket Stage
item.description: Media and social media influencers are invited to NASA’s Michoud Assembly Facility in New Orleans Monday, Dec. 9, for Artemis Day: Michoud/Stennis.

item.title: NASA TV Coverage Set for Complex Spacewalks, Briefings
item.description: Two astronauts will venture outside the International Space Station for a series of complex spacewalks this month and next to repair the Alpha Magnetic Spectrometer (AMS), a cosmic ray detector.

item.title: Boeing’s Starliner Completes Pad Abort Test for Commercial Crew
item.description: Boeing’s CST-100 Starliner spacecraft completed a critical safety milestone on Monday in an end-to-end test of its abort system.
